segments.text: I see the water overflowing, and it’s making me really anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, not noticing anything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the puddle getting bigger, and I’m worried someone will slip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are climbing for cookies, and the stool looks so unstable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to fall if he’s not careful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is watching him, and I’m scared she’ll get hurt too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen is turning into a hazard zone, and no one is doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I need to warn them, but I’m too nervous to speak up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and it’s making me really uncomfortable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t watch this anymore; it’s too stressful.
segments.speaker: PAR
